intro: Kosopoljanskya, commonly known as the Kosopoljanskya plant, is a rare flowering species native to specific regions of Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or shaded areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
